accuracy.description: The accuracy refers to the correctness of the solution or procedure provided.

efficiency.description: Efficiency refers to how quickly and optimally the problem was solved, taking into account the steps, explanations, and time taken.

clarity.description: Clarity refers to how well the solution was communicated, the appropriateness of the language used, and the overall ease of understanding.

completeness.description: Completeness refers to the extent to which all aspects of the problem were addressed and whether a full solution was provided.

adaptability.description: Adaptability refers to the ability of the solution provided to be modified and adjusted to alternative or related problems.
